stanza.line: O that you were your self but love you are
No longer yours than you your self here live
Against this coming end you shouldprepare
And your sweet semblance to some other give
So should that beauty which you hold inlease
Find no determination then you were
Your self again after your selfdecease
When your sweet issue your sweet form shouldbear
Who lets so fair a house fall todecay
Against the stormy gusts of winterday
And barren rage of death eternalcold
O none but unthrifts dear my love youknow
You had a father let your son sayso
